solution.text:
\(\frac{x+_{j}_}{_{k}_x + (_{k}_+1)} = \frac {3}{8}\)
Cross multiply, i.e. take the denominator of one side to the numerator of the other side and multiply that numerator.
\(\Rightarrow 8(x+_{j}_)=3(_{k}_x + (_{k}_+1))\)
\(\Rightarrow 8x+_{{8*j}}_=_{{3*k}}_x+_{{3*k+3}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow (_{{3*k}}_-8)x=_{{8*j}}_-_{{3*k+3}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{3*k-8}}_x=_{{8*j-3*k-3}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow x=\frac {_{{8*j-3*k-3}}_}{_{{3*k-8}}_}\)
